title: Why did SpaceX give up on “catching” falling fairings? Its VP of launch explains
summary: "You basically had this really awesome algorithm, this crazy automation."

title: A Short Ariane 6 Hot Fire Test Has Been Postponed
summary:
ESA announced earlier today that a short hot fire test of the Ariane 6 core stage equipped with its Vulcain 2.1 engine has been delayed. The test was due to take place on 29 August on the new Ariane 6 launchpad at the Guiana Space Centre in French Guiana. In a short announcement on the […]
The post A Short Ariane 6 Hot Fire Test Has Been Postponed appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: ESA postpones Ariane 6 hot-fire test again
summary: The European Space Agency says a test-firing of an Ariane 6 core stage has been postponed again, this time because of issues with ground equipment.

title: NASA Deep Space Network reaches “critical point” as demand grows
summary: Increasing demand but decreasing budgets are putting a strain on NASA’s Deep Space Network (DSN), threatening its ability to provide communications for the agency’s science missions and Artemis lunar expeditions.

title: SAIC wins $574 million contract to maintain Space Force radar sites
summary: The U.S. Space Force awarded SAIC a $574.5 million contract to maintain ground-based radar sensors used for missile warning and space surveillance.

title: United Launch Alliance readies for first Atlas V launch of the year
summary: The Atlas V launch has been delayed for safety precautions in order to shield the rocket and payload from any effects of...

title: Space Development Agency’s data-transport satellites get more complex
summary: The 72 data-transport satellites that the Space Development Agency plans to launch to orbit in 2026 will be the most complex yet.

title: SaxaVord Does Not Need Spaceport Licence to Launch HyImpulse Mission
summary:
The UK’s Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) has confirmed that SaxaVord will not need a spaceport license to host the maiden flight of the HyImpulse SR75 rocket. SaxaVord Spaceport is a proposed vertical launch facility being built on a small island off the North coast of Scotland. Shetland Space Centre Ltd, the company behind the spaceport, […]
The post SaxaVord Does Not Need Spaceport Licence to Launch HyImpulse Mission appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA invita a hispanohablantes a enviar sus nombres en Europa Clipper
summary: La NASA ha lanzado un nuevo sitio web en español para invitar al público a enviar sus nombres a bordo de Europa Clipper, una misión que iniciará su viaje a la luna de Júpiter Europa en octubre de 2024. Este nuevo sitio web forma parte de una campaña de la agencia llamada “Mensaje en una botella”, mediante la cual un poema original dedicado a Europa

title: Japanese space robotics company GITAI raises $15 million
summary: Japanese startup GITAI has raised an additional $15 million to continue work on lunar robotics technologies, three months after raising $30 million.
